intro: Pimelea brevifolia subsp. modesta, commonly known as the narrow-leaved riceflower, is a flowering plant native to southern Australia. It is a shrub with narrow, linear leaves and produces small, yellow flowers in late summer. The plant is typically found in heathlands and open forests, thriving in well-drained soils. It is valued for its ornamental appeal and is sometimes cultivated in gardens. Due to its limited distribution, it is considered a rare and vulnerable species.
